intro: Actinodaphne multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered laurel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic evergreen leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed, and it often grows in lowland forests. The botanical features of Actinodaphne multiflora make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
